comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Mr Hood (the photographer) was on HMAS ANZAC for this series of photos?

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Yes we think so, a few journalists reporting on the day appear to have been reporting from ANZAC: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16733206 Rear-Admiral E R G R Evans was overseeing the operation from ANZAC and transmitting orders to ALBATROSS and CANBERRA. Can you imagine the atmosphere? There would have been explosions and quite a rumble with the explosives being set off and the guns being fired.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
